other_tests.findings: Multiple hypoattenuating lesions in the liver, the largest in segment measuring about 5 x 4 cm, most likely are simple cysts. The appendix is rim-enhancing and dilated measuring up to 9 mm with surrounding periappendiceal fat stranding. There is a focal area of mural thickening involving the right lateral bladder wall measuring about 1.5 x 1.5 x 1.5 cm, concerning for a bladder mass. No evidence of diverticulitis.
